page.title: 01Land East of Scots Gap
page.content: This is an area of gently undulating land under cultivation. it consists roughly equally of good quality grazing land and mixed crop growing. Stock is mainly sheep, but there are some beef and dairy cattle. The land apears to be farmed with respect for conservation. Dry stone walls are in good condition, and well maintained hedgerows and wind-breaks of large deciduous trees provide habitat for wildlie and give the area scenic beauty. Population is sparse and amenities are few, consisting of pub, chapel and village hall in the tiny village of middleton.
